programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Eagles (6-6) and Jaguars (6-6) come together in the 68 Ventures Bowl from Mobile, Ala. South Alabama, on its home turf, is looking to nail down its first bowl victory in four attempts. Eastern Michigan snapped a four-game postseason skid in 2022.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Spartans compete with the Chanticleers in the Hawaii Bowl. San Jose State has won six in a row, with senior running back Kairee Robinson rushing for 782 yards and 11 TDs in those games. Coastal Carolina earned a fourth straight postseason berth.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Huskies face the Red Wolves in the Camellia Bowl. Northern Illinois defeated Arkansas State in the 2011 GoDaddy.com Bowl. The Huskies are 0-7 in bowls since, while the Wolves make their first postseason appearance since winning this bowl in 2019.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Spartans compete with the Chanticleers in the Hawaii Bowl. San Jose State has won six in a row, with senior running back Kairee Robinson rushing for 782 yards and 11 TDs in those games. Coastal Carolina earned a fourth straight postseason berth.

programme.title: Sunday NFL Countdown
programme.desc: This Sunday pregame staple debuted in 1985 and soon became a signature ESPN series. Host Samantha Ponder introduces the features and directs the storylines associated with the day's games, joined by a roster of analysts highlighted by ex-NFL players, coaches and executives including Tedy Bruschi, Randy Moss, Matt Hasselbeck, Rex Ryan and Louis Riddick. Chris Mortensen and Adam Schefter deliver breaking news and injury updates, while reporters at game sites set the scenes.

programme.title: E60
programme.desc: ESPN's morning sports magazine show, featuring the biggest names and stories in sports.

programme.title: E60
programme.desc: The origins of The Mighty Ducks of Anaheim franchise in 1993 through the team's fairytale run at the most prized possession in hockey, The Stanley Cup.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Senegalese freshman Baye Ndongo and the Yellow Jackets (8-3) take on the Wolf Pack (11-1) in the Diamond Head Classic final. Georgia Tech held off host Hawaii 73-68 in the semifinals behind Ndongo's 22 points and 12 rebounds. Nevada topped TCU 88-75.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Georgia State faces Utah State in the Famous Idaho Potato Bowl. The Aggies are no stranger to this contest, going 1-3 all-time in the Potato Bowl. Utah State quarterback Levi Williams will forego his senior year to enter the U.S. Navy SEAL training.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Eagles (6-6) and Jaguars (6-6) come together in the 68 Ventures Bowl from Mobile, Ala. South Alabama, on its home turf, is looking to nail down its first bowl victory in four attempts. Eastern Michigan snapped a four-game postseason skid in 2022.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: "NBA Countdown" serves as the primer for game telecasts on the ESPN family of networks. It's highlighted by a lively roundtable discussion and debate of the top storylines around the league. Seats at the table are reserved for folks in ESPN's stable of NBA hosts and analysts, with the latter group imparting wisdom based on their many years of playing experience.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Knicks and Bucks finish a two-game set at Madison Square Garden with this Christmas Day opener. New York is in its league-high 56th match on Dec. 25, with a 23-32 all-time mark. Milwaukee is playing its sixth straight Christmas clash, and is 5-4.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The defending champion Nuggets host the Warriors on Christmas Day. Golden State has been a holiday fixture, playing 12 of the last 13 Christmas slates to a 7-5 mark. Denver is 2-6, but defeated the Dubs 108-105 on Nov. 8 via Nikola Jokic's 35 points.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: From Crypto.com Arena in Los Angeles.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Golden Gophers and their good grades face a test in the Quick Lane Bowl against the Falcons. Minnesota was the only five-win program needed to complete the 82-team bowl lineup. The Gophers won the tiebreaker via their Academic Progress Rate.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Owls engage the Bobcats in the First Responder Bowl. Texas State entered the season as one of three FBS programs to not have played in a bowl game. Rice's Luke McCaffrey, brother of San Francisco 49ers star Christian, made 12 TD grabs this year.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: As Michael Jordan pushes his teammates hard for a sixth NBA title, his intensity and hunger for basketball dominance is in stark contrast to his mindset in October 1993, when he stunned the world by walking away from the game.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: Michael Jordan would famously use even the smallest slight imaginable to motivate himself against an opponent. And when his NBA comeback in 1995 fell short in the playoffs, he worked harder than ever to return to form.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: In 1998, a year after the Chicago Bulls defeated Utah in the NBA Finals, their path to a sixth title only gets more challenging as it goes along, as a brutal seven-game series against the Indiana Pacers decides the Eastern Conference.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: In June of 1998, Michael Jordan and the Chicago Bulls take on the Utah Jazz in an NBA Finals rematch, looking for a sixth championship and a perfect ending for "The Last Dance."

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Trojans are the de facto home team during the Birmingham Bowl versus the Blue Devils. Duke coach Mike Elko accepted an offer to become the new head coach of Texas A&M on Nov. 27. Troy toppled Appalachian State for the Sun Belt championship.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Wildcats (7-5) roll into their Las Vegas Bowl meeting against the Utes (8-4). Northwestern has won three in a row for the first time since 2020. Utah's losses came against top 25 teams. The Wildcats beat the Utes 31-20 in 2018 Holiday Bowl.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The documentary series focuses on notable sports happenings.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: ESPN Sports Betting Analysts Erin Dolan and Joe Fortenbaugh, along with host Tyler Fulghum, break down the biggest storylines through the lens of sports betting, with breakdowns, discussions and picks.

programme.title: Fantasy Football Now
programme.desc: "Fantasy Football Now" airs live on Sunday mornings during the NFL season, a time when fans are making last-minute roster moves and need the latest news from around the league. Providing the latest info are host Field Yates, analysts Mike Clay and Damien Woody, and senior writer and injury analyst Stephania Bell. Also contributing to the show are ESPN's NFL reporters, who bring fantasy players the latest intel from game sites and, in many cases, straight from the coach's mouth to give fantasy owners everything they need to know to set their lineups.

programme.title: Bad Beats
programme.desc: A look at the moments that drove sports bettors wild during recent games.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Owls and Pirates play for seventh place in the Diamond Head Classic. Temple is led by junior guard Hysier Miller, who averages 18.3 points per game. Portland 6-foot-8 freshman guard Tyler Harris goes for 12.9 points and 7.8 rebounds per contest.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Monarchs take on the Minutemen in the Diamond Head Classic fifth-place game. Old Dominion is playing without coach Jeff Jones, who is recovering after suffering a heart attack on Dec. 20. UMass comes off a 100-78 victory over Portland.

programme.title: Boxing
programme.desc: All the boxing action from around the world.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Horned Frogs (9-2) meet the host Rainbow Warriors (8-3) for third place in the Diamond Head Classic. TCU fell to Nevada 88-75 in the semifinals despite 24 points and eight rebounds by forward Emanuel Miller. Hawaii lost to Georgia Tech 73-68.

programme.title: UFC Ultimate Knockouts
programme.desc: Memorable knock-outs from throughout MMA history.

programme.title: 2023 AKC Agility Invitational
programme.desc: AKC's Fastest Dogs USA features top ranked canine competitors among the country's fastest breeds to determine who really is the fastest dog in the country. From Rock Hill, S.C.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: X Games
programme.desc: Breathtaking action from the X Games with action from events like snowboarding and extreme skiing.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Falcons (8-4) battle the Dukes (11-1) in the Armed Forces Bowl. Air Force is 4-0 in the postseason since 2016, including a win at this bowl last year, but dropped four in a row to end the season. James Madison makes its first playoff appearance.

programme.desc: Previewing the Monday Night Football matchup airing later on ESPN. programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: SportsCenter

The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: USA plays Vietnam at Eden Park in Auckland in the opening game of Group E at the 2023 World Cup. USA also faced Asian opposition in its opening fixture of the 2019 World Cup, a 13-0 win against Thailand in Reims (including five goals by Alex Morgan).

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Spain contests England at Stadium Australia in Sydney in the final of the 2023 World Cup. England defeated Spain on its way to winning EURO 2022. The Lionesses won 2-1 after extra time in the quarterfinals through a winning goal by Georgia Stanway.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Bulldogs (10-2, 1-0) and Friars (10-2, 1-0) aim to top the Big East entering 2024. Providence began its conference campaign with a 72-57 upset of No. 6 Marquette on Dec. 19, thanks to Devin Carter's 22 points. Butler has won seven straight.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 4 Wildcats and No. 14 Owls play the Desert Holiday Classic from Las Vegas. Florida Atlantic followed up its Cinderella run to the 2023 Final Four with a 9-2 start. Owls center Vladislav Goldin averages 15.1 points and seven rebounds per game.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 5 Huskies open their Big East home campaign by bracing for the Red Storm. UConn is 3-0 at the XL Center this season, winning by a combined 104 points. Huskies senior guard Cam Spencer totaled 55 points and 11 assists in those games.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Blue Demons start their Big East campaign when they host the Wildcats in Chicago. Last season, DePaul ended a 22-game slide against Villanova on Jan. 10 as Da'Sean Nelson scored 24 points in a 75-65 win, but the Wildcats split the yearly set.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Pirates and the Musketeers wrap up their schedules for 2023 with this match in Cincinnati. Xavier swept both meetings from Seton Hall last season by a combined 25 points. Ohio native Jerome Hunter (XAV) averaged 11.5 points in those victories.

programme.title: UEFA Euro Archive
programme.desc: The stories of the less established nations who have enjoyed success at the European Football Championships. The stories will be retold through archive footage, interviews and graphics.

programme.title: The Score
programme.desc: Two brothers find their bond tested when one of them is selected to play for a premier league soccer team and the other is left on the sidelines.

programme.title: UEFA Euro Archive
programme.desc: A compilation of the best moments from the UEFA European Football Championship season.

programme.title: UEFA Nations League Soccer
programme.desc: Semifinal.

programme.title: UEFA Nations League Soccer
programme.desc: Croatia takes on Spain in the final of the UEFA Nations League. Croatia earned its berth by scoring twice in extra time against the Netherlands, while Spain beat Italy on a late goal in semifinal matches. From Feijenoord Stadium in Rotterdam.

programme.title: 2023 Concacaf Gold Cup
programme.desc: The United States men's soccer team takes on Trinidad and Tobago in a CONCACAF Gold Cup Group A match. From Bank of America Stadium in Charlotte, N.C.

programme.title: 2023 Concacaf Gold Cup
programme.desc: Quarterfinal.

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Australia faces England at Accor Stadium in Sydney in the semifinals of the 2023 World Cup. England's only defeat in its 38 matches under Sarina Wiegman was a 2-0 friendly loss versus Australia at Gtech Community Stadium in London on April 11, 2023.

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Spain is up against Sweden at Eden Park in Auckland in the semifinals of the 2023 World Cup. Sweden is unbeaten in all 11 matches against Spain, including a 1-0 victory in Karlskoga in the group stage of EURO 1997 (own goal by Judith Corominas).

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Spain contests England at Stadium Australia in Sydney in the final of the 2023 World Cup. England defeated Spain on its way to winning EURO 2022. The Lionesses won 2-1 after extra time in the quarterfinals through a winning goal by Georgia Stanway.

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: England takes on Colombia at Stadium Australia in Sydney in the quarterfinals of the 2023 World Cup. The only previous meeting was in Montreal in the 2015 World Cup group stage. The Lionesses won 2-1 through goals by Karen Carney and Fara Williams.

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: USA plays Netherlands at Wellington Regional Stadium in Group E of the 2023 World Cup. This fixture is a repeat of the 2019 World Cup final. USA retained the trophy courtesy of a 2-0 win at Groupama Stadium (goals by Megan Rapinoe and Rose Lavelle).

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 4 Wildcats and No. 14 Owls play the Desert Holiday Classic from Las Vegas. Florida Atlantic followed up its Cinderella run to the 2023 Final Four with a 9-2 start. Owls center Vladislav Goldin averages 15.1 points and seven rebounds per game.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Pirates and the Musketeers wrap up their schedules for 2023 with this match in Cincinnati. Xavier swept both meetings from Seton Hall last season by a combined 25 points. Ohio native Jerome Hunter (XAV) averaged 11.5 points in those victories.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Bulldogs (10-2, 1-0) and Friars (10-2, 1-0) aim to top the Big East entering 2024. Providence began its conference campaign with a 72-57 upset of No. 6 Marquette on Dec. 19, thanks to Devin Carter's 22 points. Butler has won seven straight.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Blue Demons start their Big East campaign when they host the Wildcats in Chicago. Last season, DePaul ended a 22-game slide against Villanova on Jan. 10 as Da'Sean Nelson scored 24 points in a 75-65 win, but the Wildcats split the yearly set.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 5 Huskies open their Big East home campaign by bracing for the Red Storm. UConn is 3-0 at the XL Center this season, winning by a combined 104 points. Huskies senior guard Cam Spencer totaled 55 points and 11 assists in those games.

programme.desc: George The Iceman Gervin is a pro and college Hall of Famer who was once the most dominant scorer in the NBA. His accolades include four NBA scoring titles, nine All-Star appearances and being honored as one of the top 50 NBA players of all time.
